setup_questions.text: Does your data file depend on private information of subjects?
setup_questions.context: Question to help determine whether differential privacy is appropriate for this data file.

setup_questions.text: Which of the following best describes your data file?
setup_questions.context: The answer is used to set privacy parameters (default epsilon and delta values) which may be changed later in the process.
setup_questions.longAnswer: Information that, if disclosed, would not cause material harm, but which the organization has chosen to keep confidential

setup_questions.text: Does each individual appear in only one row?
setup_questions.context: Used to help determine dataset distance.

setup_questions.text: Is your data a secret and simple random sample from a larger population?
setup_questions.context: If the data is a simple random sample, we can use methods (amplification) to increase the accuracy and utility of the statistics you create.

setup_questions.text: Can the number of observations in your data file be made public knowledge?
setup_questions.context: If the data file size can be made public, we don't need to spend a portion of your privacy budget to estimate it.
